pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:0.5: 69. The training rule on low seats
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting on low seats while giving teachings to people sitting on high seats.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.3: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.4: “How can the monks from the group of six sit on low seats while giving teachings to people sitting on high seats?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.5: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.8: “Foolish men, how can you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.11: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.12.1: “Once upon a time in Bārāṇasī, monks, there was a low-caste man whose wife became pregnant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.16: ‘But there are no mangoes. It’s the wrong season.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.17: ‘If I don’t get any, I’ll die.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.18: At that time the king had a mango tree that was always bearing fruit.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.19: Then that low-caste man went to that mango tree, climbed it, and hid himself.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.20: Just then the king and his brahmin counselor went to that same mango tree. There the king sat on a high seat while learning the Vedas.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.22: ‘How wrong-headed this king is, in that he sits on a high seat while learning the Vedas.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.23: And the brahmin is wrong-headed too, in that he sits on a low seat while teaching the Vedas to one sitting on a high seat.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.24: And I’m wrong-headed too, in that I steal mangoes from the king because of a woman.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.26: And he fell out of the tree right there.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.29: Not he who teaches the Vedas,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.32: With a curry of pure meat:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.33: Therefore I’m not practicing the Teaching,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.34: The Teaching praised by the Noble Ones.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.35.0: The low-caste man replies in turn:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.35.1: ‘A curse it is the obtaining of wealth,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.36: And the obtaining of fame, too, brahmin;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.37: These things come with a low rebirth,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.40: Other beings will do the cooking;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.42: Because you’ll break like a jar.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.43: Even at that time, monks, I was displeased by someone teaching the Vedas while sitting on a low seat to someone sitting on a high seat. How, then, could it not be displeasing now?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.45: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.46.1: ‘“I will not give a teaching while sitting on a low seat to anyone sitting on a high seat who is not sick,” this is how you should train.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.47: One should not give a teaching while sitting on a low seat to anyone sitting on a high seat who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.48: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching while sitting on a low seat to someone sitting on a high seat who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.51: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk69:1.52: The ninth training rule is finished.
